description: Giant tamarind trees grow everywhere in Southern India, offering both shade and their sweet-sour fruits for cooking.
name: Tamarind Fish Curry Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the oil in a large saucepan. Add the mustard seeds and, when they begin to pop, the curry leaves, fenugreek seeds, and garlic. Sauté for 1-2 minutes or until the garlic turns brown. Stir in the onions and cook over a moderate heat, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until the onions are golden.

Add the turmeric and chilli powder and mix well, then add the tomatoes, tomato purée, and some salt and cook for a further 2 minutes. Add the tamarind paste and 200ml water. Bring to a boil and simmer for 12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens. Taste, adding more tamarind paste if you wish.
Cut the fish into pieces and carefully mix into the sauce. Reduce the heat and cook gently for 4-5 minutes or until just cooked through. Serve with plain boiled rice.
